intro: Schizoloma lanceolatum, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, typically in the axils of the leaves. Schizoloma lanceolatum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
